intro: Bossiaea cinerea var. tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, pale green to greyish leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heaths and woodland edges. This variant is notable for its distinctive morphology and ecological adaptation to arid environments.
